> We don't live in the age of the typewriter anymore, single line breaks have been dying for a while (see MS Word defaults and those of other word processors). Just something to get used to, I guess. Personally I used double line breaks in my posts on the old software far more often than singles, for paragraph spacing, but of course YMMV.
> 

*Double spacing* is a typewriter thing. Real typography is virtually never double spaced, and if Word does it, it's just another example of Word adding new features without being able to do text properly. 

I made my judgement based upon the claim up the thread that line spacing was defaulted to double, however. A quick look at actual text shows that this is not the case anyway, and it is only double-spacing on a carriage return (line break). This is NOT "default double spacing," though, that implies a global leading setting of something like 200-240% of font size, so that even flowed text would be double-spaced (which would be awful to try and read). Bottom line is that the forum flows text at normal spacing, and a line return adds a line.

The last paragraph, actually double-spaced (to see how awful real double spacing would be):

**Edited <time datetime="2015-11-30T16:58:17Z" title="11/30/2015 04:58  PM" data-short="8 yr">November 30, 2015</time> by tater**

Pardon my misuse of the term. Typewriters required single carriage returns at the end of every line, then a double carriage return at the end of each paragraph. Since auto word wrapping has virtually eliminated the need for single carriage returns, having one do the end of a paragraph double carriage return is the idea.

At any rate, this is a fairly minor issue compared to some of the others that are being worked on at the moment.

I have found a number of bugs on mobile making it basically un-usable for me (had to post this from a desktop):

- Clicking on the follow button at the bottom of the page freezes the page, requiring a restart of the browser.
- Backspace doesn't work, not letting you delete any text in the post as you type it, sometimes results in a page freeze.
- Cursor keeps jumping back in to quoted text, sometimes re-quoting, sometimes freezing the page.
- When clicking on the "quote" button to start a reply with a quote results in sending you back to the top of the page, requiring you to scroll all the way down to the bottom of the page to start typing. Becomes really annoying when you have to do that multiple times just to write one post, see above bugs.
- Refreshing the page or navigating of and back again in an attempt to remove a half typed post that is bugged (see above) doesn't remove the post and let you start again. You have to submit that reply to start a new one, even if that post is a mess.

Desktop bug: When trying to follow a thread the option box gets stuck on the spinning blue wheel, requiring a refresh of the page.
